add the gnu public license to the current repo

To add the GNU Public License (GPL) to your current repository, you can follow these steps:

1. Create a file named "LICENSE" in the root directory of your repository.
2. Open the LICENSE file in a text editor and copy the text of the GPL license that you want to use.
3. Paste the GPL license text into the LICENSE file.
4. Save and commit the LICENSE file to your repository.

Here is an example of what the LICENSE file might look like:

```
GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE
Version 3, 29 June 2007

Copyright (C) 2007 Free Software Foundation, Inc. <https://fsf.org/>
Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim copies
of this license document, but changing it is not allowed.
```

Note that you should replace the copyright information with your own information, and you may need to modify the license text depending on your specific use case.
